bio: Expert in traditional Chinese cuisine with a modern twist, bringing flavors from different regions of China.

recipes.cooking_method: Roast Peking duck until crispy, serve with thin pancakes, hoisin sauce, sliced cucumber, and green onions. Drizzle with sesame oil.
Cook tofu and ground pork in a spicy sauce made with Sichuan peppercorns and chili bean paste. Garnish with green onions.
Fill dumpling wrappers with a mixture of ground pork, ginger, and soy sauce. Steam dumplings over chicken broth with gelatin for a soupy filling.

bio: Mastery of Sichuan and Hunan dishes, known for bold and spicy flavors that excite the taste buds.

recipes.cooking_method: Cook noodles, toss with a sauce made of vinegar, soy sauce, sesame oil, and chili oil. Top with wood ear mushrooms.
Stir-fry chicken with dried red chilies, garlic, and ginger. Add a sauce made of soy sauce and sugar. Serve hot and spicy.
Coat fish fillets in cornstarch, fry until crispy. Make a sweet and sour sauce with pineapple, bell peppers, and rice vinegar. Pour over the fish.
